## Key takeaway

Directional variograms indicate clear anisotropy, with the strongest spatial correlation occurring along the 45Â° direction. However, the presence of direction-dependent sills suggests non-stationarity due to an underlying trend in the data. To address this, the trend may be explicitly modeled and removed prior to variogram estimation, or alternatively, a nested semivariogram with an infinite-range component may be employed to capture large-scale variation. Variogram modeling of the residuals then allows valid inference under stationarity assumptions.
